get.description: This endpoint does not require authentication. It will retrieve all of the media contained in the gallery. Standard visibility and access permissions apply. If a user does not have access to the contents of the gallery then they will be thrown an error. If a gallery is contained in multiple collections then an optional collection_id query parameter can be used to specify the collection that the gallery is a child of. This way, you can still access the media of a gallery should you lack permissions due to the parent to child relationship in one collection versus another collection. (Ex. Collection A is completely private and Collection B is public. Gallery C exists in both collections. If you do not specify the collection_id then you will always be denied access. Passing in the collection_id of Collection B to this endpoint will now give you ability to access media in Gallery C because the context of Collection B is public.)

parameters.name: gallery_id
parameters.description: The ID of the gallery you are selecting children from

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: The ID the collection the gallery is a child of. This parameter is used when a gallery exists in multiple collections and you need to specify the collection it exists under.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Optional password parameter used to access the contents of a gallery with permissions set.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Denotes the amount of results per page

200.description: Returns a gallery's media. Only returns the ID, type, display order, creation time, and modification time of each media.

get.description:
Retrieves the gallery permissions.

When authenticated, retrieves all the native and inherited access rights along with their credentials.
When not authenticated, retrieves all the access rights without their associated credentials.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Optional collection_id parameter to retrieve inherited permissions from (if the gallery inherits from the collection)

200.description: Gets lists of native and inherited gallery permissions depending on access level

get.description: Search the collections. This endpoint requires the user to be authenticated. It will return a list of collections owned by the user. For pagination to work, both per_page and page query parameters must be set.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Collection ID to match in the query

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Collection name to match in the query. Having this parameter set will always default to an exact name matching unless specified otherwise by the usage of the match parameter

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Limit collections to children of the provided collection ID. Pass blank to find collections with no parent.

parameters.name: match
parameters.description: Flag that denotes whether to perform a partial name match. This parameter will only work if the name query parameter has been set and the only value available for this parameter is false. Setting this parameter to false will perform case insensitive partial name matching.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort by an attribute. The available attributes to sort by is creation_time, modification_time, name, and display_order. The default behavior is to sort the collections by the attribute in ascending order. This can be changed with the usage of the 'sort_direction' query parameter.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Sort direction. This parameter requires the usage of the 'sort_by' query parameter. Setting this parameter to one of the allowed values will set the direction of the sort.

get.description: Get a collection by ID. This endpoint is available to both public and authenticated users. Certain fields are only returned a non-null value if the users is authenticated and has permissions. The format of the collection id is defined by the regex : ^C0000[a-zA-Z0-9._]{11}$ (For example: 'COOOOEXAMPLECOLL').

get.description: Get a collection's children. This endpoint does not require authentication. Accessing a collection's children depends on the visibility and access rights of the collection and if the user has permissions to view it. If a user does not have permission to access the children then a permission error will be thrown. The endpoint will return all galleries and collections contained in the specified collection. Certain fields will be returned back as null if the user does not have ownership access. Unlike getting the children of a gallery, collections can only exist under ONE collection and not multiple collections. Per_page and page MUST BOTH be set in order for pagination to work.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Collection ID to query the children of

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Optional password parameter that can be used for collections that allow passwords for access

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Optional token parameter that can be used for collections with token access

parameters.name: visibile
parameters.description: Set to true to only return items that are visible to all users

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of items to return per page

200.description: Returns a collection's children which contains either galleries or collections.

get.description: Get a collection's parent. This endpoint does not require authentication. The ability to view a collection's parent is dependent on whether or not the user has access to the collection. Some fields will be returned as null if the user does not have ownership access. The fields are 'created_at' and 'modified_at', and 'access_id'. If a parent is not found then the data object will be empty.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Collection ID to query for its parent

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password for collections that have password access

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token for collectiond thst have token access

get.description: Get information on a specific child of a collection. This endpoint does not require authentication. The ability to retrieve a specific child of a collection is dependent on the visibility and access options set to the parent collection. If a user does not have access to the collection then they will not be able to view a specific child of a collection. Some fields will be returned as null if the user does not have ownership access. The fields that are impacted are 'created_at', 'access_id', modified_at'. If a child is not found with the id then a 404 error will be thrown.

200.description: Returns information about a single child of a collection

get.description: Get a collection's children count. This endpoint does not require authentication. A user will not be permitted to access the count of the children in a collection unless given access to the collection. Any user with insufficient permissions to a collection will be thrown an error. An optional parameter 'visibile' can be passed in to retrieve the count of only publicly visible children of a collection.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Collection ID to retrieve the children count from

parameters.name: visibile
parameters.description: Boolean value to denote if only publicly viewable children of a collection is returned in the count.

200.description: Returns the children count for a collection in the meta object of the payload

get.description: Get a collection's link. This endpoint is fully public. It will generate a link to the user's/org's collection with the name and id of the collection in the link. In the example, the {name} will be replaced with the collection's name. There is no restriction to generating the link, but viewing the contents of the collection in the link is still subject to visibility and access permissions.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Collection ID to retrieve a link from

200.description: Custom Link Response - Returns a shareable link in the payload to the collection specified

get.description: Media GET (aka media search). At least one of the following is required in order for the search to take place: (terms, custom_metadata, date_start, date_end, user_id, org_id, photographer_id, virtual_agency_id, orientation, state, country, country_iso). It is good practice to limit your page size when searching as callbacks for additional data can become expensive.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: User id to perform the search on

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: Organization id to perform the search on

parameters.name: collections
parameters.description: Limit search to files within given collections. Comma separated list of collection ids.

parameters.name: galleries
parameters.description: Limit search to files contained in given galleries. Comma separated list of gallery ids.

parameters.name: custom_metadata
parameters.description: Limit search to files containing custom metadata. Requires use of the org_id parameter. Parameter format is a JSON object containing field_id and option_id key-value pairs. e.g. {"Foo_field_123":"Foo_tag_abc","Bar_field_456":"Bar_tag_def"}.

parameters.name: terms
parameters.description: Search terms. Performs text search based on the terms across a variety of attributes such as file name, keywords, caption, etc.

parameters.name: personal_use
parameters.description: Media is available for personal use.

parameters.name: royalty_free
parameters.description: Media is available as royalty free.

parameters.name: media_type
parameters.description: Type of media (image | video | audio | doc) or a comma separated list

parameters.name: contact_info
parameters.description: Contact info. Query string based on key-value pairs. The available keys are - city, country, address, postal_code, region, email, phone, and url. For example, "?contract_info=city,NYC,country,USA is equivalent to city being NYC and country being USA.

parameters.name: is_empty
parameters.description: Denotes which parameters must be empty. Comma-separated list.

parameters.name: not_empty
parameters.description: Denotes which parameters must have a value. Comma separated list.

parameters.name: match_all_terms
parameters.description: Match all terms. Return all keywords specified in the terms parameter. Default to true.

error.title: Missing or invalid API key
error.detail:
Missing or invalid API Key error. This occurs when an API key is either missing from the request to the server or
is invalid. This error can be resolved by including the API key in the request URL with the api_key parameter or in the HTTP request headers.
If you do not have an API key, you can request one on our website.

get.description: Get media by ID. This endpoint works for both public and authenticated users. Certain fields are non-null only if users have the permission to view them. Users must provide a valid media ID which can be a video, document, audio, or image id. This endpoint will return data corresponding with the type of media that was retrieved.

parameters.name: media_id
parameters.description: A media ID. Either a video, doc, audio, or image

Error.description: This object generates errors in compliance with RFC 7807 API Problem

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes

screen_height_max.description: Max screen image height in pixels

screen_width_max.description: Max screen image width in pixels

searchable.description: Boolean flag that denotes if the image is publicly searchable

model_released.description: Boolean flag that denotes if the image model is released

property_released.description: Boolean flag that denotes if the image property is released

flagged.description: Boolean flag that denotes if the image has been flagged by the photographer

focal_point_x.description: Core product specific variable. Denotes the focal point of the image on the x-coordinate plane

focal_point_y.description: Core product specific variabnle. Denotes the focal point of the image on the y-coordinate plane

created_at.description: Date and time the image was last updated

modified_at.description: Date and time the image was originally uploaded

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes

model_released.description: Boolean denoting if the model is released

property_released.description: Boolean denoting if the property is released

created_at.description: Date and time the audio was last updated

modified_at.description: Date and time the audio was originally uploaded

format.description: Describes the format of the file

created_at.description: Date and time the document was last updated

modified_at.description: Date and time the document was originally uploaded

model_released.description: Boolean flag denoting if the model is released

property_released.description: Boolean flag denoting if the property is released

created_at.description: Date and time the document was last updated

modified_at.description: Date and time the document was originally uploaded

name.description: Name of Gallery or Collection object (Whichever it is)

description.example: Trip to DR with my brothers and sisters

key_image_id.description: ID of the Image that is the key image

is_listed.description: Flag that denotes if it is listed on the public site

id.description: A unique identifier for this occurrence of the problem

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

status.description: The HTTP status code set by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: An human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

id.description: Media ID. Can be an audio, video, image, or document ID.

download_image_size.description: Download Image Size (number of pixels of longest dimension)

org_id.description: ID of the organization that the collection belongs to.

key_image_id.description: ID of the Image that is the key image
